Improvements.Improvement: Extract nested if conditions to methods
Improvements.Description: The method `processInput` is too long and contains many nested if conditions, making it hard to read and maintain. We can extract each condition to a separate method to enhance readability and maintainability. It also helps in writing unit tests for each specific case.

For handling commands, a switch statement can be more readable and efficient than an if-else structure, especially when dealing with strings. Replace the top-level if-else structure with a switch statement.

Improvements.Change_Diff:
- System.out.println("- setting " + achievementName + " to 'achieved'");
+ logger.info("- setting {} to 'achieved'", achievementName);
Improvements.Description: Using System.out.println for logging is not a recommended practice. It is not thread-safe, and there's no way to configure its output. Replace all System.out.println calls with a proper logging framework like Log4j or SLF4J.
